title: Questor share tip: Avoid Tullow as debts weigh
text:
519.50 +11.0000 
The African oil explorer and producer has agreed to extend its borrowing with its banks, but the risks to the shareholders remain, says Questor 
Tullow Oil (LSE: TLW.L - news ) 185.4p+16.3p Questor says AVOID 
Tullow Oil [LON:TLW] , the beleaguered African oil explorer, was given a stay of execution by its lenders yesterday, sending the shares up almost 10pc. 
However, Questor would still give this heavily indebted energy company a wide berth. 
Tullow searches for and produces oil in Africa, and the relatively high cost of production in this region means profits have been hit by the crash in commodity prices during the past 18 months. 
Tullow is in an awkward position after borrowing billions to build the infrastructure necessary to access the black gold it finds. But just as production ramps up, the oil price has collapsed. 
The group of banks that lent Tullow the money have agreed to give the company more time. The firm said yesterday that the six-monthly review of lending, which is based on the reserves of oil still in the ground, has left the borrowing arrangements unchanged. 
Tullow said at its half-year results that its TEN project in Ghana was still on track to start production by the middle of next year, and this will increase the companyâ€™s share of West African (Other OTC: EMMLF - news ) production to 100,000 barrels of oil per day during the next two years. 
The company has also hedged prices to insulate it from sharp falls, and said that during the first half the average hedged price was $70.60 per barrel. 
However, unless prices recover and production rapidly increases, equity holders are greatly exposed. 
The company reported net debts of $3.6bn at the end of June, against net asses of $3.8bn. Investec (LSE: INVP.L - news ) forecast net debts to rise to $4bn by the end of December. 
The dividend has already been cut and the banks might eventually see some return on their loans, but the risks for those holding the equity are clear. Avoid.
